content:
Diagnosis
	1. Metastatic prostate adenocarcinoma with ductal features
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	None indicated

	Systemic therapy
	1. ADT commenced January 2024 - Leuprorelin 3-monthly
	2. Docetaxel chemotherapy commenced February 2024 - discontinued after 2 cycles due to clinical deterioration
	3. Enzalutamide 160mg daily started April 2024

	Radiotherapy
	Palliative radiotherapy to T8 vertebra March 2024

	Clinical studies
	Not eligible

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with rising PSA and new bone pain

	Current issues
	1. Worsening bone pain
	2. Progressive fatigue
	3. Urinary symptoms with intermittent catheterisation

	Summary of consultation
	Unfortunately [redacted name] has shown evidence of disease progression despite recent initiation of enzalutamide. His PSA has risen from 567 to 890 over the past 4 weeks. He describes new onset pain in his right hip and increasing lower back pain. His mobility has significantly declined and he now requires a wheelchair for anything more than short distances. Performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 3.

On examination, there is marked tenderness over the right hip and lumbar spine. Neurological examination shows no focal deficits but power is generally reduced due to pain and deconditioning.

Given the MMR-deficient status of his tumor, we have discussed starting pembrolizumab immunotherapy. I have explained the rationale, potential benefits and side effects in detail. He wishes to proceed with this option.

	Further investigations
	Urgent CT scan to exclude spinal cord compression

	Medication prescribed
	1. Increased MST to 60mg BD
	2. Added pregabalin 75mg BD for neuropathic pain

	Follow up
	Urgent review in 1 week with scan results
Referral to palliative care team made today

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function weekly
Consider community physiotherapy referral

cancer_timeline.value: Discontinued Docetaxel after 2 cycles due to clinical deterioration
PSA risen from 567 to 890 over 4 weeks showing disease progression

patient_facts.value: New onset right hip pain and increasing lower back pain
Marked tenderness over right hip and lumbar spine, reduced power generally due to pain and deconditioning
Requires wheelchair for anything more than short distances

status_updates.value: Metastatic prostate cancer showing rapid progression through multiple lines of therapy. Disease progression confirmed on enzalutamide with rising PSA and new bone pain
Disease progression on enzalutamide with PSA rise and new symptomatic bone metastases
Significant decline in mobility, now wheelchair dependent with deterioration to ECOG PS 3
Plan to commence pembrolizumab immunotherapy due to MMR-deficient status
Urgent CT scan to exclude spinal cord compression
Urgent review in 1 week with scan results, referral made to palliative care team
